result.execSummary:
Dean R. Kline was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Dean R. Kline was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean R. Kline

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:52 AM.
Defendant Dean R. Kline in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives his Extradition rights and signs waiver in court. 
Court signs Waiver of Extradition Rights.
Extradition hearing on April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(10:59 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dean R. Kline appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video and advises the defendant does not want representation.
Defendant advises is willing to waive extradition.
Court requests the defendant be brought over in person to address extradition.
(11:21 AM case recalled.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dean R. Kline appeared in court, in custody.
Defendant advises is willing to waive extradition.
Defendant begins shouting and swearing and deputies advise while escorting defendant from the courtroom, defendant is refusing to sign any paperwork.
Court advises since the defendant is refusing to sign the extradition paperwork, the defendant is refusing waiver of extradition.
Court sets $250,000.00 cash bond and advises defendant is held for 30 days in the Eau Claire County Jail.
